description: The crash occurred in the middle of the intersection of a two-lane roadway.  Conditions were dark with lights and dry in the evening on a weekday.  The posted speed limit for both roads was 40 kmph (25 mph).     V1 was a 2005 Toyota Matrix hatchback traveling westbound in the right lane approaching an intersection.  V2, a 2005 Hyundai Accent coupe, was traveling northbound in the right lane approaching the same intersection with a stop sign.  V2 did not stop at the stop sign and the front of V2 struck the left side of V1 in the intersection.  V1 then rolled 6-quarter rolls and came to final rest on its roof facing eastbound.  V2 came to final rest facing northwest.     V1 was driven by a 31-year-old male who was transported with moderate injuries to a local hospital prior to our arrival.  V1 was towed due to damage.  The driver stated that he was traveling through the intersection and the other car just drover through the stop sign, she didn't even slow down.  Driver of V1 gave a partial interview in the ambulance, but would not respond to numerous attempts to contact him via both landline and cell phone.

The crash occurred in the intersection of a two-lane roadway controlled by a stop sign.  Conditions were daylight and dry in the afternoon on a weekday.  The posted speed limit for both roads was 25 MPH.    V1 was a 2003 Saturn LW 300 station wagon traveling eastbound in the 1st travel lane approaching an intersection controlled by a stop sign intending on going straight.  V2, a 2004 Ford Explorer SUV, was traveling northbound in the 1st travel lane approaching the same intersection intending on going straight.  V1 drove thru the intersection and the front of V2 struck the right side of V1 in the intersection.  V2 then struck a curb.  V1 and V2 came to final rest facing northeast.     V1 was driven by a 56-year-old female who sustained minor injuries but was not transported.  She stated that she was not familiar with this roadway.  As she approached the intersection she was distracted by an ambulance and did not see the stop sign.  She failed to stop for the TCD and struck the front of V2 in the intersection.  The driver of V1 did not take any avoidance actions and was traveling between 21-30 MPH at the time of impact.  V1 was towed due to damage.

This crash occurred at the intersection of a two-way roadway with one lane in each direction and a one-lane, one-way roadway.  It was daylight and the roadway was straight and level and it was clear with patches of ice that formed from the night before.  The speed limit was 48kph (30mph).  	Vehicle #1, a 1999 Ford Crown Victoria, was traveling westbound on the two-way roadway.  Vehicle #2, a 1993 Ford Crown Victoria, was traveling northbound on the one-way roadway.  At the intersection, the front of Vehicle #2 contacted the left side of Vehicle #1.  Vehicle #1 then struck a pedestrian standing on the northwest corner of the intersection.  The pedestrian sustained no injuries.	The 1999 Ford Crown Victoria was driven by a 48-year old male who sustained no injuries and was not transported to the hospital.  The vehicle was used as a livery taxicab, and he was transporting one passenger.  He stated that he had the green light and was trying to avoid Vehicle #2 by steering right.  The driver also stated that Vehicle #2 was traveling at a high rate of speed and disregarded the traffic control signal.  This vehicle was driven from the scene.  The driver of Vehicle #1 was not thought to have contributed to the crash.
